name: St. Margaret Pole

locations.description: Countess of Salisbury, martyred in London, England

summary: Margaret Pole was an English noblewoman and martyr who was executed during the reign of Henry VIII. She was the Countess of Salisbury and a member of the Plantagenet family. She refused to acknowledge the king's supremacy over the Church and was imprisoned in the Tower of London for two years. At the age of 67, she was beheaded. She is one of the Forty Martyrs of England and Wales and is remembered for her courage and loyalty to the Catholic faith.
